dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - a COMPUTER MONITOR. Lines of code appear, as they are typed. main( ) { extrn a, b, c; putchar(a); putchar (b);putchar (c); putchar('!'*n');

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a `hell'; b `o, w'; c `or

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - a view above an ultra-cool, ultra-designed open-plan office. In a kitchen area, young men and women mill and chat. Casually dressed. Feels like an intelligent, relaxed environment. Behind them, more young men and women sit at desks, in fr of screens and keyboard. Each workstation is personalised. Photographs of friends family, or pets. Cutting from magazines. Ironic superhero/video-game figurines.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - the hands of the young man writing code.   This is CALE He types fast, with two fingers.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - EXTREME CLOSE UP of a pinhole web-cam lens in CALEB'S monitor.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - the POV of the web-cam. Looking back at CALEB. Twenty four. Glazed. Ear buds in, connected to cell phone Head bobbing slightly to the music. As we watch from the monitor POV, we can see the computer facial recognition system in operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imaged as vector boxes, which track CALEB'S face, and the faces of all the people behind him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - the COMPUTER MONITOR. On which a message appears, in a small window, over the c

dialogues.speaker: VIP EMAIL RECEIVED
dialogues.text: subject: HIDDEN

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - the monitor web-cam POV. As CALEB stops typing. He gazes at the message. Then clicks on the link. Then mouths the word: Fuck. CALEB reaches for his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - the CELL PHONE POV, seen from the tiny camera above the screen, as CALEB lifts the phone, and starts keying-in a text. We see facial recognition software flickering over CALEB' features, and reacting to shifts in his expression.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - the cell phone. The screen.   The tiny camera nestled a it. Lens glinting. On the screen, a time-bar extends next to the word: sending A beat later, a reply text message appears. WTF?   seriously!?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - the WEB CAM POV, watching CALEB react to the arrival of text.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - cell phone screen. CALEB sends the word:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: yes A beat later, a stream of text messages start appearing: Buena estoria bro omfg fucking AWESOME :o) take me take me?!? Caleb > [infinity symbol]

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - the computer monitor POV. Behind CALEB, a few of the people behind CALEB in the off are reacting. One stands and applauds. A GIRL comes out from behind her desk, runs over to CALEB and embraces him from behind planting a kiss on his cheek CALEB still looks dazed. He still has his headphones in. Still in the audio bubble which, despite the commotion around him, remains unburst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spectacular mountain landscape. Waterfalls drop down massive rock faces to inland lakes. Rivers push through forest. Forest spreads across valley floors, which rise t snow peaks. 3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB wakes abruptly - - to find himself in the front seat of a helicopter. The pilot, JAY, is a man in his forties. Outside the window is the mountain landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long was I out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fell asleep almost as soon as we left the airport. CALEB looks around.   Wipes sleep out of his eyes.   Gets bearings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Can't believe I've been missing this. I was so psyched to be coming here, I was awake all night. JAY smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a programmer, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bay facility?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long Island. I work on algorithms for the search engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Algorithms. Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. But I knew you were a programmer. Soon as I set eyes on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a good thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Means you and Mr Bateman speak the same language. I'd say that's a good thing. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you know him pretty well. The pilot laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never even met him. I only fly this shuttle between the airport and his residence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did see him one time. Stood on one of these mountain ridges. JAY shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assume it was him, anyway. No one else around for a hundred miles. JAY glances over at CALEB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how does a programmer from Long Island get to be meeting the CEO?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won a competition. It was kind of like a lottery, for employees. The winner got to spend a week with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The president can't get Mr Bateman on the phone, but you got the golden ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell of an opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me. I know it. CALEB looks out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incredible here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alaska.   Most beautiful place on Earth. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long until we get to his estate? JAY chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been flying over his estate for the past two hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter flies over a vast white glacier. 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter flies over the lip of a WATERFALL, reveali valley. The valley floor is a forest, and a single bright green meadow. Sunlit, like a jewel in the icy mountains. A white-water river runs through it. 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB looks down at the breathtaking view as the helicopt banks, turns, and descends. 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meadow flowers whip in the rotor wash as the helicopter touches down in the vast meadow. By the landing site is a collection of huge metal crates. All have Chinese characters on the side. The rotor blades slow, but don't stop. JAY exits. 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAY holds open the door as CALEB exits the helicopter cab CALEB looks around, his eyes adjusting to the bright suns outside. JAY goes to the side of the helicopter, pops open a hatch and removes CALEB'S luggage. A large suitcase with wheels CALEB looks around. Apart from the packing crates, there no man-made structures to be seen. CALEB shouts over the engine noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving me here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is as close as I'm allowed to the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What building? The pilot gestures vaguely towards the white water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow the river. JAY hands CALEB his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please get a safe distance from the blades. The pilot gets back inside the helicopter, and closes the door. CALEB hurriedly retreats with his bag. Moments later, in a roar of wind and noise, the helicopte lifting off. Equally suddenly, the noise is fading, and the helicopter soaring upwards, and banking back towards the glacier. Then it is gone.    Bird song and wind rush replace engin noise. CALEB suddenly looks very isolated. 10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB walks along the banks of the fast-flowing river, awkwardly bumping his wheeled suitcase over the ground. The banks of the river start to climb, to an intimidating drop. It feels that this can't be the right way. CALEB reaches into his pocket and pulls out his mobile ph No signal at all. He puts his phone back in his pocket. 11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB rounds a bend in the river. Ahead, almost hidden in trees, there is a steel and glass structure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB walks towards the house through the trees. In the ground, in a grassy clearing, he finds a circular window, reflecting the sky. He walks up to the window, and looks inside. It reveals what is effectively a glass-covered well - abo four metres deep, with smooth concrete sides. At the bottom of the well is a brightly-lit room, which appears to be an office of some sort. There is a desk, wi monitors, and a chair. But apparently no one inside. Beyond the clearing, in the tree-line, CALEB sees - almos camouflaged by forest - the dark shapes and straight line a low, one storey building complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB approaches the building. As he nears the entrance - - CALEB startles, as an AUTOMATED VOICE speaks to him, fr an unknown source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caleb Smith. CALEB tracks the source of the voice. Near what seems to be the front door, a pillar protrudes the ground. Head-height. With a GLASS SCREEN on one side. Below the screen is a DISPENSER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please approach the console and face the screen. CALEB looks into the screen, and as soon as he has locked eyes with his own reflection, the screen FLASHES. A singl bright strobe. Almost immediately afterwards, something small clatters i the DISPENSER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your keycard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB picks the object up.      It's a credit-card sized On it, there is an embedded chip, and a photograph of his face. He looks comically surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Can we do another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your keycard now may be used to enter the residence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB walks up to the front door. Beside the door, a KEYCARD PLATE is set into the wall, wi RED LED LIGHT. He holds his keycard ID. The RED LED light changes to BLUE. CALEB pushes the front door, and it swings open. 13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens to a glass-walled staircase, which l down to an open-plan room. At the bottom of the staircase, CALEB waits to see if he welcomed, or noticed. But he is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Then he is startled a second time, by sudden commencement a THUMPING SOUND. Abrupt.    Rapid.    More or less rhythmic.   From somewh nearby. He exits in the direction of the noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB enters a dining area. Which now reveals... ... a huge glass door. It presents an arresting view of a garden, river, and the mountains behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is open, and through it, we see the reason for t thumping sound. Just outside, on a patio, in the sunshine, a man is worki PUNCH BAG. 14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB exits the dining area to an area of neat garden, looking over the river, and surrounded by the mountain ranges. The punch bag is suspended by a chain on an exterior flan wall of the house. The man working it is wearing shorts, and is shirtless. Bathed in sweat. His hands are not protected by gloves. Only wraps. Spots blood seep through the pale material around his knuckles. This is NATHAN BATEMAN.   He's thirty. After a flurry of punches, NATHAN breaks off. Breathing hard, he wipes at his eyebrows with the back of wrist. Sweat droplets cascade down his face. Then - - NATHAN senses the other presence. He turns to see CALEB.    Standing by the open glass wall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caleb. NATHAN beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caleb Smith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hi. NATHAN starts unravelling his wraps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. I've been so looking forward to this. 15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN walks past CALEB, and goes to a bar area, where th is a jug of non-specific vegetable juice waiting, and a glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, come in. CALEB puts his bag down. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want something to eat or drink after your journey? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    Thank you. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? NATHAN pours himself a glass of the vegetable juice. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd been thinking we'd have breakfast together, but to be honest, I can't eat anything right now. I gotta tell you - I woke up this morning with the mother of all fucking hangovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? NATHAN laughs. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you wouldn't believe. And if I have a heavy night, I always try to compensate the next morning. Exercise. Juice. Anti-oxidants. You know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Silence, as NATHAN drinks. CALEB feels he needs to say something. Looking around, he sees a collection of empty beer bottle the kitchen counter. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Was it a good party? NATHAN doesn't answer. He's still drinking. The silence extends a little.   Verges on odd. NATHAN puts his empty glass down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party? NATHAN looks at CALEB.   His expression is unreadable. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caleb. I'm going to put this out there so it's said. CALEB waits. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're freaked out. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I am? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You're freaked out by the house, and the mountains, because it's all so super-cool. And you're freaked out by me. To be meeting me. In this room, having this conversation, at this moment. Right? CALEB doesn't have time to answer. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I get that. The moment you're having. NATHAN smiles. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But dude, can we get it behind us? Can we just be two guys? Nathan and Caleb. Not the whole employer- employee thing. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Beat. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to meet you, Nathan. CALEB holds out his hand. NATHAN beams. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to meet you too, Caleb. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When CALEB takes his hand back, there is a little smear o blood on his fingers. He discretely wipes it on his trousers. 16

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN and CALEB enter an elevator. It has no buttons.   Only a keycard plate. NATHAN swipes his card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down. The elevator starts to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water flows over rocks. 17

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB and NATHAN exit the elevator, into a glass corridor The floor is polished concrete. The walls and ceiling are glass, behind which diffused light glows. At regular intervals, glass doors are set, glowing with t same light, flush with the walls. Beside the closed doors are keycard plates and soft red L CALEB carries his bag, looking slightly encumbered next t NATHAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess the first thing I should do is explain your pass. It's simple enough. It opens some doors, but it doesn't open others. And that just makes everything easy for you, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Uh, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're like: oh fuck, I'm in someone else's house, can I do this, can I do that? And this card takes all that worry away. If you try to open a door and it stays shut: okay, it's off limits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you try another door, and it opens: it's for you. NATHAN stops by a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try this one. CALEB hunts around in his pockets for his keycard. Then swipes the card on the plate. The LED turns blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it's for you, Caleb. 18

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN follows CALEB into a bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like? It has the vibe of a mid-level business hotel.      Bed, TV. Except it has no windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your room. You got yourself a bed, cupboards, a little desk, and a bathroom through there. A little fridge. NATHAN opens the fridge.       Inside it is full of bottl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cosy, right? CALEB puts his bags down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.    This is great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something wrong.       What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the windows. You're thinking: there's no windows. And it's not cosy. It's claustrophobic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No way. I wasn't thinking that. I was thinking: this is really cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caleb. There's a reason the room has no windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... There is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. In many ways, this building isn't a house. It's a research facility. Buried in these walls are enough fibre optic cables to reach the Moon and lasso it. NATHAN sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I want to talk to you about what I'm researching. I want to share it with you. In fact, I want to share it with you so much, it's eating me up inside. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's something I need you to do for me first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What? NATHAN indicates the desk - where a pen sits next to a printed document. 19

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB sits at the desk in his room, holding NATHAN'S pen. In front of him is a sheet of paper, which reads, at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `The signee agrees to regular data audit with unlimited access, to confirm that no disclosure of information has taken place, in public or private forums, using any means of communication, including but not limited to that which is disclosed orally or in written or electronic form...' CALEB glances back at NATHAN on the bed. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I need a lawyer. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's standard. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't feel very standard. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it's not standard. NATHAN shrugs. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I tell you? You don't have to sign. We could spend the next seven days shooting pool and getting drunk together. Bonding. And when you discover what you missed out on, in a year or so's time, you'll spend the rest of your life regretting it. CALEB turns back to the desk. Looks at the paper. Then hesitates a final moment - - and signs. When he looks round, NATHAN has moved from the bed, and i standing directly behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good call. NATHAN takes the piece of paper. Folds it.   Puts it in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what the Turing Test is? CALEB reacts - immediately knowing what NATHAN has just implied. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yeah.    I know what the Turing Test is. NATHAN waits. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's where a human interacts with a computer. And if the human can't tell they're interacting with a computer, the test is passed. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what does a pass tell us? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That the computer has artificial intelligence. Beat. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Are you telling me you're building an AI? NATHAN shakes his head. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already built one. NATHAN stands. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And over the next few days, you're going to be the human component in a Turing Test. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Holy shit. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Caleb. You got it. Because if that test is passed, you are dead center of the single greatest scientific event in the history of man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you've created a conscious machine, it's not the history of man. It's the history of Gods. NATHAN smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - what appears to be a neon coloured jellyfish. Tendrils like axons, hanging in a black-blue liquid space.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL -
dialogues.text: - the jellyfish is contained in a glass orb. Which is held in an exposed cavity at the back of machine skull-shape... ... which is part of a robot girl. Her name is AVA. She's an extraordinary piece of engineering. Proportioned as a slender female in her twenties, her lim and torso are a mixture of metal and plastic and carbon fibre. The carbon fibre is charcoal colour. The plastic is cream The metal has the yellow-warmth of nickel. The shapes of her body approximate the form of muscle. are biceps, and breasts. Her hands have five delicate digits. Her body-structure is covered in a delicate skin. The ski is a mesh, in the pattern of a honeycomb. Like a spiderwe it is almost invisible unless side-lit. The one part of her that is not obviously an inorganic construct is her face - which is that of a strikingly beautiful girl. Created in a defined oval, from the top o the forehead to just below her chin. Indistinguishable fr a real girl in its appearance and in the way it moves - except for one thing. There is a very slight, almost imperceptible blankness in eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we observe AVA, she fits a section of skull-plate to t back of her head, which obscures the glass orb and jellyf structure. Then - - she half turns. As if having become aware of another presence in the room.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL -
dialogues.text: - the room in which AVA stands. AVA'S living area is made up of three primary spaces. The main area is the OBSERVATION ROOM. A large area, arranged around a glass box, from which she can be viewed At the back of the observation room, behind a sheet of se opaque glass, is the PRIVATE AREA. This contains a bed-li structure, a desk, a wardrobe, and a mirror. And behind the private area is the GARDEN AREA. This is a small decorative indoor garden, lit by lamps. The garden sealed off from AVA by a thick wall of glass. There are also several oval discs positioned around the r made of some kind of dark non-reflective material. These induction plates. And there is a chair, which faces the glass observation b And facing that chair, inside the observation box, is ano chair. Beside which, CALEB stands. A beat - - as CALEB and AVA see each other for the first time. Then - - AVA starts walking. Revealing a secondary impact of her engineering: how she moves. The unconscious precision of steps. The fluidity of her action. CALEB is transfixed as she covers the length of the room her chair. Then she sits down. And speaks. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice has no digital inflections.    It is just the v of a girl. CALEB gathers himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hi. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Caleb. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Caleb. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Do you have a name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.     Ava. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm pleased to meet you, Ava. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pleased to meet you too. CALEB sits opposite her. He is alone on his half of the glass.    Nathan is nowher be seen. But on the ceiling, and attached to the walls, on both si of the glass, there are several CCTV cameras. Trained variously on CALEB and AVA. Lenses twitching. CUT BACK to AVA. She watches CALEB.    Then cocks her head slightly to the AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nervous? CALEB frowns. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Why do you ask that? A beat. Then AVA repeats her question. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes.   A little. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel nervous too. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Do you? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you feel nervous? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never met anyone new before. Only Nathan. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Then we're both in quite a similar position. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you met lots of new people before? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None like you. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Beat. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.    Let's break the ice. He glances at her.   Observing. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know what I mean by that? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I mean? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overcome initial social awkwardness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's have a conversation. If we talk, we'll both relax, and get to know each other at the same time. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. What would you like to have a conversation about? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we start with you telling me something about yourself. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you like to know? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever comes into your head. AVA pauses a moment. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. You already know my name. And you can see that I'm a machine. (beat) Would you like to know how old I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One what?     One year?   Or one day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One. A beat on CALEB.   Processing. Her answer feels like the near non-sequitur that typicall betray AI responses. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that seem young to you? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite young. (beat) When did you learn how to speak? AVA pauses, as if considering this question for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I did learn. I always knew how to speak - and that's strange, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because language is something that people acquire. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some believe language exists in the brain from birth, and what is learned is the ability to attach words and structure to the latent ability. Beat. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you agree? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't know.       I have no opinion on that. Beat. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to draw. CALEB says nothing. Just watches AVA.    Again, lets the non-sequitur sit. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any of my pictures with me now, but I can show you them tomorrow. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds good.       I'd like to see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Beat. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you come back tomorrow, Caleb? CALEB smiles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.     Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA also smiles. And suddenly - - there is a strong sense of something very human there. the way the smile lights up her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. 21

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A view of the house over the meadows. The sun setting is behind the mountain peaks, making the edges of the clouds glow like light-bulb filaments. 22

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB and NATHAN are in the dining area. It is set for dinner.   Only two chairs. NATHAN is at the table, nursing a bottle of Peroni beer. CALEB stands by panoramic window, looking at the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? CALEB turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. I was just ordering my thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't order. Just speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fascinating. When you talk to her, you're through the looking glass. NATHAN nods.    Approving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Through the looking glass'. You've got a way with words there, Caleb. You're quotable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's someone else's quote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I wrote it down. That other line you came up with. About how if I've created a conscious machine, I'm not man. I'm God. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't think that's exactly what I said. NATHAN doesn't seem to hear. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just thought - fuck. That's so perfect. It's so good for the story, when we get to tell it. `I turned to Caleb, and he was looking back at me. And he said: you're not a man, you're a God'. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't say that. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it was you said.    I wrote it down. As a kind of punctuation mark, NATHAN downs the remains o his beer. Then stands, and gets another from the bar. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So anyway. First impressions: you're impressed. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Although - NATHAN laughs. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Although'? There's a qualification to you being impressed? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No qualification to her. Just - in the Turing test, the machine should be hidden from the examiner. And there's a control, or - NATHAN waves a hand. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're past that. If I hid Ava from you, so you just heard her voice, she would pass for human. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real test is to show you she is a robot. Then see if you still feel she has consciousness. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're probably right. Her language abilities are incredible. The system is stochastic, right? NATHAN looks at CALEB blankly. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Non-deterministic. NATHAN still says nothing. CALEB presses on. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first I thought she was mapping from internal semantic form to syntactic tree-structure, then getting linearised words. But then I started to realise the model was probabalistic, with statistical training - or at least some kind of hybrid. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caleb. I understand you want me to explain how Ava works. But - I'm sorry. I don't think I'll be able to do that. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me! I'm hot on high-level abstraction, and - NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts in) It's not because you're too dumb. It's because I want to have a beer and a conversation with you. Not a seminar. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Oh.   Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool. NATHAN studies at CALEB for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just answer me this. What do you feel about her? Nothing analytical. Just - how do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel... CALEB pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... that she's fucking amazing. NATHAN smiles. Then lifts his bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude.   Cheers. CALEB lifts his bottle too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers. The glass of the bottles touch. 23

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB stands in his boxer shorts, brushing his teeth by t sink. REVEAL several long scars on his back. Neat. Unusual.      Long-healed.   But from serious wound surgery. 25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. The clock reads 01:32 am. The soft glow from the digital readout throws a light on remote control.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL CALEB.
dialogues.text: Eyes closed.    For a beat. Then his eyes open.   He's wide awake. He turns over in the bed. Then turns back again.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: 2:28 am. CALEB lies watching the digital clock, as the numbers cha to 2:29 am. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it. He reaches for the remote control. CLICK. The TV at the foot of the bed switches on, suddenly light up the room with cold TV glow. CALEB squeezes his eyes shut, momentarily dazzled by the brightness. When his eyes open again, instead of seeing a TV station, sees a LIVE FEED from a CCTV camera. It shows the OBSERVATION ROOM. CALEB sits upright in bed. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What the fuck? AVA is sat at the table. Drawing.

dialogues.speaker: CUT BETWEEN -
dialogues.text: - CALEB watching AVA. - and varying CCTV ANGLES of AVA as she draws. The different TV channels flip between feeds from the var cameras. CALEB is transfixed by the imagery. Her posture. Her legs tucked beneath the chair.   The cur of the breasts on her synthetic torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CCTV images become CALEB'S POV.       The things he i observing. CLOSE-UPS of her face.     Her eyes.   Her mouth. The way she bites her lip in an expression of concentrati As when she smiled, there is a powerful sense in this tin gesture of her feeling sentient and human. Even more so because her face fills the screen, hiding th mechanical parts of her form. Throughout, we never clearly see what AVA is actually drawing.

dialogues.speaker: END ON -
dialogues.text: CALEB.   Glazed. Then ABRUPTLY - - the TV goes dead. And the digital alarm clock goes dead. And the windowless room is plunged into total darkness, a total silence. As if the house had been previously filled with a soft hum of power, which we were unaware of until was gone. In this, we hear CALEB breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power cut.     Back up power activated. Soft emergency lighting comes on. CALEB hesitates a moment. Then gets out of bed. Goes to his bedroom door. Beside the keycard plate, the LED is red. He swipes it with his card. The LED stays red. AUTOMATED VOICE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full facility lock-down until main generator is restored. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Are you kidding? He tries his card again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full facility lock-down until main generator is restored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB looks around his windowless room. Which suddenly has the quality of a prison cell. Beats pass. Then - - as abruptly as the power went off, it comes back again. The emergency lighting goes off, the TV and digital alarm clock turn back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power restored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB stands in the flickering TV light. Then he tries his card again. This time, the LED turns blue, and the door opens.    Rev the GLASS CORRIDOR outside. 27

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB walks out of his room. The glass corridor illuminates as CALEB enters. Ahead, one of the doors off the corridor is ajar. 28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB enters the room with the open door. It appears to be empty.    Still and silent.   Low lit. Only one area is properly illuminated: a wall, on which a large JACKSON POLLOCK drip painting hangs. CALEB walks towards it. Studies the strange strands of looping colour for a moment. A TELEPHONE, on a low table. CALEB walks over to it, with a half glance over his shoul as if sensing he is doing something that - obscurely - he shouldn't. Then he picks up the handset. It's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits some buttons. It stays dead. There is a slot by the phone. CALEB puts two and two together. He reaches into his pock Pulls out his KEYCARD. Puts it in the slot... ... and a light on the handset glows red. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, dude. CALEB startles.   Turns. NATHAN is lying on a sofa. A bottle of Peroni rests on hi stomach. On the carpet beside him are a couple of empties NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have clearance to use the phone. NATHAN'S voice is very slightly slurred. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand. Given Ava. And you being kind of an unknown. I mean - a great guy, and so on. Instant pals. But... CALEB puts the handset back in its cradle. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did you want to call? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. No one really. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ghostbusters. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd ya want to call? Ghostbusters. You don't remember that? It's a good movie. A ghost gives Dan Ackroyd oral sex. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering how the phone worked. That's all. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing awake at this time, anyway? Did you come to join the party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Something happened in my room. Some kind of power cut. So I came to see what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. The power cuts. Yeah, we've been getting them recently. I'm, uh... working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't open the door to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a security measure. Automatic lockdown. Otherwise anyone could open the place up just by disabling the juice. NATHAN smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it happens again, relax.   Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. NATHAN lifts his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet dreams. 29

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above the mountains, dense star constellations wheel in t clear sky. 30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB is woken by light flooding on to his face. The door to his room has been opened. Outside is the bright glass corridor. CALEB sits up to see a GIRL entering his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks Japanese. She's stunningly pretty.     And she doesn't say anything. Just walks in, carrying a tray with a cafetiere, which sh puts on CALEB'S bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hi. The JAPANESE GIRL doesn't answer. Just turns, and leaves. 31

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the garden, near the hanging punch bag, there is an outdoor gym area. A collection of free-weights and exerci equipment. NATHAN is lying on an inclined board, with his feet hooke around a bar, doing sit ups. CALEB approaches, carrying his coffee. NATHAN continues to exercise as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Sorry to send Kyoko to wake you, man. I just didn't want too much of the day to slip by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It was a good thing.     Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's some alarm clock, huh?   Gets you right up in the morning. CALEB smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So.   Day two. You set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. NATHAN finishes his set, and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the plan today?    Hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. I'm still trying to figure the examination format. Testing Ava by conversation is kind of a closed loop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like trying to test a chess computer by only playing chess. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How else would you test a chess computer? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It depends what you're testing it for. You can play it to find out if it makes good moves. But it won't tell you if it knows it's playing chess. Or if it even knows what chess is. NATHAN starts adding weights to curl dumbbells. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's simulation versus actual. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. And I think being able to differentiate between those two is the Turing test you want me to perform. The difference between an `AI' and an `I'. NATHAN laughs. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `An AI and an I'. Beautiful. I'm going to start following you around with a fucking dictaphone. NATHAN glances over at CALEB. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, do me a favour. Ease up a little on the text-book approach. All I want is simple answers to simple questions. Last night, I asked how you feel about her. And you gave me a great answer. NATHAN starts doing curls. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the question is: how does she feel about you? A beat.    On CALEB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - CALEB and AVA facing each other through the glass of th observation room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought you a drawing. AVA holds a piece of paper to the glass. The marks on it totally abstract. A mesh of tiny black marks, that swirl around the page like iron filings in magnetic field patte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What's it a drawing of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. AVA looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.   I thought you would tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do drawings every day. But I never know what they're of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you not trying to sketch something specific? Like an object or a person. She shakes her head as she takes the picture down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   What object should I draw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want.   It's your decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it my decision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm interested to see what you'll choose. AVA pauses a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to be my friend? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Of course. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it be possible? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't it be? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our conversations are one-sided. You ask circumspect questions, and study my responses. AVA looks at CALEB directly.    Meets his gaze evenly. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true, isn't it? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You learn about me, and I learn nothing about you. That's not a foundation on which friendships are based. CALEB is taken aback. Aware that the AI has just wrong- footed him on a point of argument. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... That's a fair comment. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So - you want me to talk about myself. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want me to start? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your decision. I'm interested to see what you'll choose. And now CALEB is aware that AVA has just - gently - used sarcasm. He looks at her, frowning slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in response, in a very human way, AVA arches an eyebr CALEB laughs. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Ava. Well - you know my name. I'm twenty four. And I work at Nathan's company. You know what his company is? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Book, named after Wittgenstein's notes, is the world's most popular internet search engine, processing an average of ninety four percent of all internet search requests. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you live, Caleb? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brookhaven, Long Island. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it nice there? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I've got an apartment. Kind of small. But - it's a five minute walk to the office. And a five minute walk to the ocean, which I like. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you married? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your status single? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yeah. They lock eyes, just for a moment. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your family? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grew up in Portland. No brothers or sisters. My parents were both high school teachers. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) And if we're getting to know each other, I guess I should say they're both dead. Car crash when I was fifteen. In fact I was in the car with them. Back seat. But it was the front that got the worst of it. A long beat. A kind of processing pause for AVA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. CALEB nods. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent a lot of time in the hospital. Nearly a year. Got into coding. By the time I made it to college, I was pretty advanced. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An advanced programmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Nathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. CALEB hesitates.   Back-tracks. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or - kind of. Nathan wrote the Blue Book base code when he was thirteen. If you understand code, what he did was - Mozart or something. Beat. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like Mozart? CALEB smiles. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Depeche Mode. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like Nathan? CALEB misses a beat.    Thrown momentarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    Of course. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Nathan your friend?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - one of the CCTV cameras that are observing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A good friend? He hesitates. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, a good friend is - He breaks off.     Feeling the camera, watching. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only just met. It takes time to get to know -

dialogues.speaker: AT THAT MOMENT -
dialogues.text: - all the power abruptly shuts down, plunging the room in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power cut.     Back up power activated. Then the soft emergency lighting lifts up, and throws the observation room into a completely different light. Weirder. Cast from LED strips on the floor, illuminating CALEB and AVA's faces from below. In the low light, we see a detail of AVA'S honeycomb skin mesh that we were not able to see before. It glows, soft, like phosphorescence - and this changes t way we see AVA. Where the mesh is almost invisible in bri conditions, it is now the dominant describer of her form. instead of seeing AVA as a primarily robot structure, we see the curves and lines of a naked female body.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - the CCTV CAMERAS.     Which are unpowered, hanging dead

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - CALEB, glancing round at the door to the room, where th panel LED glows red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching CALEB with a strange intensity. The vague quality of blankness in her eyes is completely gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caleb. CALEB turns.    Sees the way AVA is looking at him. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Wrong about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... In what way? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me? CALEB frowns. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Ava, I don't understand what you're - AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts in) You shouldn't trust him. You shouldn't trust anything he says. AVA presses her hand to the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. Then - - the emergency lighting suddenly dims... ... and the normal lighting starts fading up. CALEB turns -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - just in time to see the CCTV CAMERAS twitch back into l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power restored. When CALEB looks back at AVA, she has returned to her previous posture, facial expression, and manner. She looks directly at CALEB, and talks, as if continuing conversation they have been having.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - and if we made a list of books or works of art which we both know, it would form the ideal basis of a discussion. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prompts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that okay, Caleb? They lock eyes for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes. AVA smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. 33

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trees and shrubs cast long shadows across the manicured l Through the glass wall, we can see the Japanese girl, KYO preparing sushi. 34

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB and NATHAN sit at the dining table. Lanterns are laid out across the terrace. KYOKO lays out different kinds of salad between them. Eac is beautifully prepared. Leaves are spread and overlapped like fish scales. As she does so, she knocks a bottle of wine on the table. It tips, and lands on its side, and immediately starts emptying. A deep red stain, blossoming across the linen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB pushes back his chair as the liquid pushes towards then starts to fall to the floor. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Kyoko. Are you serious? (to Caleb) Did it get you? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   No problem. CALEB takes his napkin, and leans down to start wiping th floor. Then KYOKO appears beside him. She holds her hand out for the napkin. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give her the cloth. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kyoko) It's okay, don't worry.    I've got it. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude - you're wasting your time. She can't speak a word of English. Her hand remains outstretched. CALEB hesitates.   Then hands her the napkin. KYOKO kneels and starts to wipe the wine off the floor. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a firewall against leaks. Means I can talk trade secrets over dinner with an HOD or CEO, and know it will go no further. Right, Kyoko? She looks up at her name. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it also means I can't tell her I'm pissed when she's so fucking clumsy that she pours wine over my house guest. KYOKO goes back to cleaning around CALEB'S feet. CALEB looks visibly uncomfortable. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she gets that you're pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Because I am pissed.     Hey. Kyoko. KYOKO looks over again. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go-go. She stands, and leaves. NATHAN walks to over the bar, where he picks up another bottle. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny. It doesn't matter how rich you are: shit goes wrong. You can't insulate yourself from it. It's supposed to be death and taxes you can't avoid. But actually it's death and shit. NATHAN walks back to the table.    Fills CALEB'S glass. his own. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like these power cuts. You would not believe how much I spent on the generator system here. But I'm getting failures every day. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why they happen? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The system was supposed to be bullet proof, but the guys who installed it obviously fucked something up. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you call them back? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's too much classified stuff here. So after the job was done, I had them all killed. CALEB shoots a glance at NATHAN.    Confirms: just joking NATHAN drains his glass. Then refills. CALEB'S glass is still untouched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway.   Here's to your second day. Cheers. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers. They drink. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how did it go?    What have you got to report? CALEB hesitates. Then answers.   Casual. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw how the day went, didn't you? I mean, I assume you're watching on the CCTV. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.    But I want to hear your take. Beat. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was one interesting thing that happened with Ava today. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yeah? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She made a joke. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. When she threw your line back at you. About being interested to see what she'd choose. I noticed that too. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It got me thinking. In a way, the joke is the best indication of AI I've seen in her. It's discretely complicated. Kind of non-autistic. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a play on words, and a play on me. She could only do that with an awareness of her own mind, and also of awareness of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She's aware of you, all right. NATHAN drinks.   Watching CALEB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about the power cut? CALEB freezes up.    Subtly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The power cut. That was the only bit I couldn't see. All the cameras fail, I lose audio, the works. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened? CALEB takes a sip of his wine. NATHAN waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing?    She didn't remark on it at all? CALEB puts the glass down.     And meets NATHAN'S gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    Not really. ON NATHAN'S GLASS - refilling. The view through it, of CALEB, disappearing in the red liquid. 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB stands in shorts, in front of the sink, having a sh He leans forwards into the mirror, as if checking to make sure he shaved properly on his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he hears the noise again.   The servo, making a tiny corrective movement. CALEB catches his own gaze in the mirror. Then he deliberately steps sideways, and turns his head. Ostensibly to check the other cheek. But actually to have shifted his position. And he hears the noise again. Very faint.   But definitely there. A micro beat. Then CALEB pulls back and continues shaving. Not giving any outward indication that he has just figure out that there is a camera behind the bathroom mirror. 37

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean-shaved, CALEB walks into his bedroom. On the TV, the live feed of AVA'S room is playing - thoug she is not in shot. Subtly, CALEB'S gaze flicks to different points around th room. To the full-length mirror on the wall. The high vent for the air-conditioning system. The TV itself. CALEB hesitates for a moment. Then pulls on a T-Shirt.   Picks up his ID card.   And ex

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - the TV. AVA walks in to the locked-off CCTV shot. She walks towards an induction plate, rests her hand agai it, and starts charging herself. As she does so, almost imperceptibly, the lights dim, and slight static charge passes over the television screen. 38

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB walks along the glass corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Systematically trying his ID CARD on the doors he passes. He tries one. Then another.    Then another.   Then another. Every single door remains locked. 39

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB enters a small room with a view over the river and garden. It is virtually the only room apart from his own that he seems able to gain access to. The lights are all off. The room is only lit by the moonlight through the sliding glass wall, and lanterns in garden. He starts walking towards the glass wall. Then stops. On the patio, NATHAN is working the punch bag. KYOKO stands a few feet away from him, holding a white to With the glass wall closed, no noise of the impacts penetrates into the room. CALEB watches. NATHAN'S attack on the bag seems strange. More extreme th the hard workout we saw the first time he was using the b This seems brutal.   Almost frenzied. For a few moments, the attack on the bag is observed in silence, from inside the main room. We can only hear the sound of CALEB'S breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the punch bag, and a sudden explosion of noise.   Of im and exertions. Blood smearing the leather where it has soaked through th knuckle wraps. Then - - BANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A particularly hard right hook connects, and splits the b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - CALEB.   Watching. Coloured strips of ribbon are visible through the split i the bag. NATHAN stands, catching his breath. Then he reaches out a hand. KYOKO hands him the towel. NATHAN wipes his face. Then reaches out again, this time catching KYOKO'S arm. He pulls her towards him, and starts to kiss her. Reaching under her shirt. Pulling her skirt up over her thighs. 42

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB re-enters his room, and closes the door. After a beat, the lights in the corridor fade out. 43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon hangs in the sky. 44

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything in the frame is black and white. CLOSE UP on AVA'S meticulous abstract pictures, scattered a table. CALEB is looking at them. REVEAL he is in the observation room. But he is on AVA'S side of the glass. And AVA is on his side. Seen through the opaque glass tha divides the private area from the observation area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava? CALEB walks to the connecting corridor, and enters it. 45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door leads CALEB straight out into the gardens. In black and white, the backdrop of mountains and clouds like an Ansel Adams. A short distance ahead of CALEB, standing on the grass, h sees AVA. She locks eyes with him. Smiles. He starts to walk towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - CALEB waking, in his dark bedroom. Lit by light from his TV. Where AVA lies on her bed, seeming to be asleep. CALEB sits up. Thinking. Perhaps replaying his dream.   Gazing at AVA'S resting form. Then reaches for the remote control on the bedside table, switches the TV off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - a brand new punch bag hangs in the patio.   Swinging slightly in the breeze. 49

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB and AVA face each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA is holding up a piece of paper to the glass. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drew the picture of something specific, as you asked. The drawing is constructed with the same tiny black ink m as before. But now they have ordered into a coherent blac and white image. It depicts AVA'S view OF THE ENCLOSED GARDEN IN HER ROOM. Beat. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it would be interesting to see what I would draw. Is it interesting? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   It is. She takes the drawing down. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you never been outside this building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never walked outside. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been outside the room I am in now. AVA thinks a moment. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think there was another room in which I was constructed. But I have no memory of it, so it's similar to your relationship with the womb. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Where would you go if you did go outside? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean if I could go outside.    If I was permitted. CALEB says nothing. Does not overtly respond to the empha she has placed on her lack of freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But their gaze locks for a beat. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure. There are so many options. Beat. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a busy pedestrian and traffic intersection in a city. CALEB smiles. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A traffic intersection. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a bad idea? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't what I was expecting. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A traffic intersection would provide a concentrated but shifting view of human life. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People watching. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Beat. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could go together. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a date. Another beat.    On AVA.    Looking at CALEB. Then - AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something else I wanted to show you. Apart from the picture. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I feel nervous. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might think it's stupid. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I will.   Whatever it is. AVA hesitates. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then - close your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Okay. He closes his eyes. AVA stands, and walks to the PRIVATE AREA at the back of observation room. As she walks, CALEB reopens his eyes. Through the semi-opaque dividing glass, he watches her. ghost image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the PRIVATE AREA, she opens a wardrobe space, which reveals clothes, and a hair-piece. Then she starts to get dressed. First a summer dress. Then stockings. Then a long-sleeved cardigan. She checks her reflection in the mirror, and adjusts the clothes slightly. Making sure that as much of her robot f is covered as possible. Then she puts on the hair-piece.     Short, brown hair. Finally, she makes a subtle adjustment to her face. Simil to putting on make-up, she adjusts the intensity of her o skin tones. Her lips redden. Her cheeks blush slightly. A discreet line of black extends like mascara around her ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the ghost shape through the opaque glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she starts to move back towards him, CALEB recloses hi eyes. And keeps them closed, as he hears her approach. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now open your eyes. CALEB opens his eyes. And sees AVA. Transformed. By covering the robot form of her chest and arms and legs and adding the hairpiece, she has taken a huge visual ste towards appearing human. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I look? The answer is - however pretty she looked before, she now looks prettier. It's as obvious to the camera as it is to CALEB. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look... good. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took me a long time to select these clothes. I tried different colours and styles, and tried to anticipate your reaction. Do you think the choices suit me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do they bring out my best features? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... They do. AVA lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. She walks back to the glass divider, and sits down. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I'd wear on our date. CALEB reacts slightly. But smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. First the traffic intersection. Then maybe a show. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like us to go on a date. CALEB hesitates. Then decides this can't have been loaded the way that it sounded. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   It would be fun. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you attracted to me? Beat.   It was loaded exactly as it sounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you attracted to me? You give indications that you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Micro expressions. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (echoes) Micro expressions. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way your eyes fix on my eyes, and lips. The way you hold my gaze, or don't. Beat. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I read them incorrectly? CALEB swallows. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think about me when we aren't together? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes, at night, I wonder if you're watching me on the cameras. AVA watches CALEB closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I hope you are. CALEB shifts on his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now your micro expressions are telegraphing discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure you'd call them micro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to make you uncomfortable. Silence. 50

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB sits in front of the fireplace in the main room. NATHAN joins him, bringing a beer for each of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you give her sexuality?   An AI doesn't need a gender. She could have been a grey box. NATHAN sits opposite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm not sure that's true. Can you think of an example of consciousness, at any level, human or animal, that exists without a sexual dimension?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have sexuality as an evolutionary reproductive need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. Maybe not. What imperative does a grey box have to interact with another grey box? Does consciousness exist without interaction? NATHAN takes a drink of his beer. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, sexuality is fun. If you're going to exist, why not enjoy it? You want to remove the chance to fall in love and fuck? He leans forward, conspiratorially. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, yes. In answer to your real question: you bet she can fuck. I made her anatomically complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has a cavity between her legs, with a concentration of sensors. Engage with them in the right way, and she'll get a pleasure response. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure response. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll come. So if you want to screw her, mechanically speaking, you can. And she'd enjoy it. CALEB swallows. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't my real question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.     My real question was - CALEB breaks off. NATHAN keeps watching. There is a sudden sense that NATHA is on the money. On some level, that was CALEB'S real question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My real question was: did you give her sexuality as a diversion tactic? NATHAN smiles slightly. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't follow. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a stage magician with a hot assistant. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. So: a hot robot, who clouds your ability to judge her AI. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. So. Did you program her to flirt with me? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if I had, would that be cheating. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't it? NATHAN lets the question hang. Behind them, KYOKO prepares dinner in the kitchen area. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your type, Caleb? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of girl? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of salad dressing. Yes, of girl. In fact, don't even answer. Let's say it's black chicks. NATHAN brushes away whatever protestation CALEB might be about to make. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the sake of argument, that's your thing. So - why is it your thing? Because you did a detailed study of all racial types, and cross-referenced the study with a points-based system? No. You just are attracted to black chicks. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A consequence of accumulated external stimulus, that you probably didn't even register as they registered with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did you program her to like me or not? NATHAN shrugs.   Insouciant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I programmed her to be heterosexual. Just like you were programmed to be heterosexual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody programmed me to be straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you are attracted to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is childish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is adult. And by the way, you decided to be straight? Please. Of course you were programmed. By nature or nurture, or both. NATHAN stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be honest, Caleb, you're kind of annoying me now. This is your insecurity talking, not your intellect. CALEB opens his mouth to reply, but NATHAN shuts him down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN and CALEB stand in front of the Pollock drip paint

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this guy, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson Pollock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackson Pollock. The drip painter. He let his mind go blank, and his hand go where it wanted. Not deliberate, not random. Someplace in between. They called it automatic art. NATHAN gazes at the canvas. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's make this like Star Trek, okay? Engage intellect. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Kirk. Your head is the warp drive. `Engage intellect'. What if Pollock had reversed the challenge? Instead of trying to make art without thinking, he said: I can't paint anything unless I know exactly why I'm doing it. What would have happened? CALEB thinks. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never would have made a single mark. NATHAN clicks his fingers. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? There's my guy. There's my buddy, who actually thinks before he opens his mouth. He'd never have made a single mark. The challenge is not to act automatically. It's to find an action that is not automatic. From talking, to breathing, to painting. NATHAN glances back at CALEB. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To fucking. Even falling in love. A beat. NATHAN kills his beer. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the record, Ava is not acting as if she likes you. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And her flirting isn't an algorithm to fake you out. You're the first man she's ever seen who isn't me. And I'm like her dad, right? So can you blame her for getting a crush on you? NATHAN glazes a moment.    Then comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    You can't. 51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In her room, AVA stands in front of the mirror. She is wearing the summer dress she put on earlier. Checking her reflection from different angles. Subtly girlish.    Unself-conscious. Then - - she starts to take the dress off. Throughout the narrative, we have almost only ever seen A in an unclothed form. But now - having been clothed - the undressing seems to make her naked. And the act itself feels charged. Sexualised, in the way clothing is unbuttoned, and dropped, and her shape is revealed. Finally, once she is completely undressed - - AVA turns.     And glances. Straight at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his bedroom. Watching AVA, at this exact angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the bank, a little distance from the house, there is a dead animal. Its species is indistinct. It's little more than a bundle of matted brown hair. Its lower half lies in the water. The quick moving river has stripped the bones of flesh, s and fur. REVEAL KYOKO in the background.   Watching the river. 54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB exits his room - - to find NATHAN in the glass corridor. Waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hey. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to show you something cool. 55

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN swipes his card against a plate. The LED turns blue. 56
