dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN leads CALEB into a laboratory, filled with android future tech. Along the left-hand wall are sections of android bodies - limbs, torsos, hands - lined in cabinets. On the opposite wall are a collection of heads. Skull-for some with complex carbon-fibre and pneumatic muscle structures, ready to frown or smile, without their synthe flesh covering. The synthetic faces are separate. Hanging on armatures, l hats on hat-stands, waiting to be worn. In the middle of the room is a kind of operating table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is the virtual womb that Ava was talking about. Where she was constructed. CALEB is stunned by the sight. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.   Take a look. NATHAN walks over to the synthetic faces, and picks one o them up. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you knew the trouble I had getting an AI to read and duplicate facial expressions... Know how I cracked it? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you did any of this. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost every cell phone has a microphone, a camera, and a means to transmit data. So I switched on all the mikes and cameras, across the entire fucking planet, and redirected the data through Blue Book. Boom. A limitless resource of facial and vocal interaction. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hacked the world's cell phones? NATHAN laughs. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all the manufacturers knew I was doing it. But they couldn't accuse me without admitting they were also doing it themselves. NATHAN puts the face back on its armature. NATHAN moves to one of the skull forms. He moves the curved top plate, revealing the skull cavity Inside is an ellipse orb, the approximate volume of a bra filled with what looks to be blue liquid. Suspended in th liquid is the neon jellyfish we glimpsed previously in AV NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we have her mind. Structured gel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The axon-like tendrils glitter and flicker with tiny puls of light. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to get away from circuitry. Needed something that could arrange and rearrange on a molecular level, but keep its form where required. Holding for memories. Shifting for thoughts. NATHAN removes the orb, and hands it to CALEB. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is her hardware? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wetware. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the software? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely you can guess. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Blue Book. NATHAN nods. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was the weird thing about search engines. They were like striking oil in a world that hadn't invented internal combustion. They gave too much raw material. No one knew what to do with it. CALEB looks at the orb in his hand.   Into the shimmering liquid. It looks like deep space, filled with star fields. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My competitors were fixated on sucking it up, and trying to monetize via shopping and social media. They thought engines were a map of what people were thinking. But actually, they were a map of how people were thinking. Impulse, response. Fluid, imperfect. Patterned, chaotic. CALEB looks at NATHAN a moment. Then hands him the orb back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you want to show me this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said. Because it's cool. CALEB waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And - I was thinking about your exchange with Ava yesterday, and our conversation afterwards. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know there was a bit of heat between us, but you actually made a really good point. About the grey box, and the magician's assistant. It is a distraction, her sexuality. It wasn't intentional, but it is there. NATHAN rests the mind-orb back in the skull cradle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stuff we're doing together: it can be a head-fuck. Believe me, I know. So I thought I'd bring you down here. Just to remind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remind me of what? NATHAN gestures at the room around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Synthetics. Hydraulics. Metal and gel. Ava isn't a girl. In real terms, she has no gender. Effectively, she is a grey box. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a machine. 57

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB looks at AVA through the glass. We watch him.   And stay on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In college, I did a semester on AI theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a thought-experiment they gave us. It's called Mary in the black and white room. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary is a scientist, and her specialist subject is colour. She she knows everything there is to know about it. The wavelengths. The neurological effects. Every possible property colour can have. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she lives in a black and white room. She was born there, and raised there. And she can only observe the outside world on a black and white monitor. All her knowledge of colour is second-hand. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then one day - someone opens the door. And Mary walks out. And she sees a blue sky. And at that moment, she learns something that all her studies could never tell her. She learns what it feels like to see colour. An experience that can not be taught, or conveyed. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thought experiment was to show the students the difference between a computer and a human mind. The computer is Mary in the black and white room. The human is when she walks out. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that I was brought here to test you? 58

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An interior wall, covered in coloured post-it notes.   At least hundreds, probably thousands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bottom of the wall, fallen notes have collected li miniature yellow snow drift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No. Reveal the room. NATHAN'S study. A simple space. One part analogue: the wa of post-its. One part digital: a desk, in the middle of t STUDY, with a bank of monitors, and a slot - into which NATHAN'S KEYCARD is inserted. On the ceiling is the CIRCULAR WINDOW that CALEB saw when first arrived. Sat at the desk, watching the monitors, is NATHAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you think I was here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know. I didn't question it. I was... pleased. To meet you. And then... Beside the desk, there is a daybed. On it, KYOKO lies.     Naked.   Apparently sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to test if you have a consciousness, or if you're just simulating one. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan isn't sure if you have one or not. Reveal the monitor screens on the desk. Some show live feeds from CALEB'S BEDROOM and BATHROOM, a AVA'S PRIVATE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you? Do you think I have a consciousness? Long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure either. NATHAN is watching the feed from the OBSERVATION ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where AVA and CALEB are sat, either side of the dividing glass. Having the conversation we have been hearing. We pick up the conversation from NATHAN'S distanced and voyeuristic POV. Locked-off CCTV. Voices played through speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on monitor screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does that make you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on monitor screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes me feel... She breaks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on monitor screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... sad. NOW REVEAL - one of the other monitor screens. It shows an angle on AVA we have not seen before. From th viewpoint, we can see something just below the frame of t observation window, on AVA'S side of the glass. A small induction plate. On this angle, we see AVA rest her hand against it. At that moment - - the screens simultaneously go black. All lights die. Another POWER CUT. In the reflection from the dark monitor screens, we can s NATHAN'S face. It remains frozen.   Expressionless. Then he reaches for his pen.   Jots down a few words on a it. Then walks to the wall of notes, and sticks it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the observation room. In the emergency lighting, CALEB and AVA face each other silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CCTV are lifeless. AVA glows softly. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you weren't sure if I was conscious. But you are sure. Beat. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell from your micro- expressions. Beat. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you tell me that I shouldn't trust Nathan? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he tells lies too. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lies about what? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including the power cuts? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think it's possible that he's watching us right now? That the blackouts are orchestrated, so he can see how we behave when we think we're unobserved. AVA lifts her hand to reveal a disc on her left palm. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I charge my batteries   via induction plates. If I reverse    the power flow, I cause a surge   equal to the static discharge of a   lightning strike. It overloads    the system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You're causing the cuts? AVA raises her right hand. She touches it against the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we can see how we behave when we are unobserved. A beat. Then CALEB raises his hand. Mirroring her movement. And also touches the glass, as if their palms are making contact through the divider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - KYOKO'S naked form. The camera settles over her face. And we see she's not sleeping.    Her eyes are open. But she's completely motionless. Her gaze fixed somewhere in abstract distance. She doesn't feel alive.   She feels dead. But eventually she blinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gazing at his dead monitors, reflected in the screen. Moments later, the POWER comes back on. The screens flick back to life, replacing NATHAN'S reflection, revealing CALEB and AVA in the observation ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the river that runs along the valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN and CALEB climb up the side of the waterfall at th head of the forested valley. NATHAN is ahead. He reaches an outcrop of rock, with a wall of violent wat behind him. CALEB struggles to catch up. As soon as he reaches the outcrop, NATHAN moves on. 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN and CALEB sits near the base of a spectacular glac Behind them, from a blue cave cut into the ice, water flo A silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we talk about the lies you've been spinning me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN glances over at CALEB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What lies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't win a competition. And there was no lottery to meet you. I was selected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's obvious, once I stop to think. Why would you randomly select an examiner for a Turing test? You could have had some bean-counter turn up at your front door. Or the guy who fixes the air conditioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your feelings hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB doesn't answer. NATHAN shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The competition was a smoke screen. I didn't want anyone to know what I was doing here, or why you were required.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a Blue Book employee, you were pre-screened. Loyal. And I needed someone who would ask the right kind of questions. So I did a search, and found the most talented coder in the company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN corrects himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or - second most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands.    Looks up at the ice structures around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? Instead of seeing this as a deception, see it as proof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proof of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Caleb. Fuck modesty. You think I don't know what it is to be smart? Smarter than everyone else around you. Smarter than all the other kids, jockeying for position in school, college, work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the light on you.   Not lucky. Chosen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above them, clouds fragment and reform. 64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night has fallen. CALEB lies in the clearing, looking up at the stars. The glow from the CIRCULAR WINDOW to NATHAN'S STUDY is li full moon on the grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB stands. Looks down the light-well to NATHAN'S STUDY. Where he sees NATHAN and KYOKO. They are having sex. CALEB watches.    Just for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - CALEB standing in the shower. He shuts his eyes.
- images of AVA. Torso, hands, mouths.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH OF -
dialogues.text: - AVA and CALEB about to kiss.    But their lips never contacting.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - CALEB opening his eyes. He exhales. Then switches off the taps. 66

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB enters his bedroom wearing boxer shorts. The TV plays the live stream from the observation room. On the screen, we can see AVA, sitting at her table, draw As CALEB pulls on a T-shirt - - behind him, on the TV, we see AVA suddenly look round. A moment later NATHAN enters the frame. There's no volume on the TV, so we can't hear their excha Only see it. CALEB is unaware of the silent exchange behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As NATHAN and AVA talk, NATHAN reaches out to AVA. His ha touches the side of her cheek. The gesture is not quite neutral. Feels predatory, but not unambiguously so. Then he tugs at the material of her shirt. Pulling up the sleeve from her wrist. Revealing the robot structure of h arm. AVA pulls away.       Tugs the material back down - - and NATHAN takes a corrective movement step to regain h balance. Showing that he is drunk. Only now - - CALEB turns. And freezes.    Seeing the television. On the screen, NATHAN reaches down to the table. He picks up the drawing AVA was working on, and he looks it for a moment. They exchange a few words. Then abruptly NATHAN rips drawing in half.      Drops it floor. Then turns, and exits. Leaving AVA alone. 67

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On CCTV, we watch CALEB walk fast down the glass corridor 68

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB enters the Jackson Pollock room. Standing by the painting, he can see KYOKO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyoko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYOKO turns at the sound of her name, but doesn't respond

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyoko - where's Nathan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! You really don't speak a word of English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB walks over to her, and takes hold of her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said: where's Nathan? KYOKO looks at CALEB. Then, in answer to his question, she reaches up to the to button of her shirt and pops it open. CALEB releases her wrist at once. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck? She undoes the next button, and pulls open the shirt, revealing her bare chest. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told you once. You're wasting your time speaking to her. CALEB turns. NATHAN has entered. He's holding a drink.   His words are slurred. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: However. He walks, slightly unsteadily towards a Lutron control pa set into the wall. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would not be wasting your time... His hand hovers uncertainly over the buttons. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... if you were dancing with her. His finger lands. Immediately, the lighting in the room undergoes a complet change. Transforming from the discreet and tasteful low light of evening, into the coloured glows of a night-club Simultaneously, from unseen speakers, DANCE MUSIC starts playing. CALEB stands - frozen by the surrealism of what has just happened. KYOKO starts walking to the center of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And once taken position, she starts dancing. NATHAN calls to CALEB. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on!   Dance with her. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't want to. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like dancing? His body is starting bob on the beat. He gestures at KYOKO. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does! CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) I don't fucking believe this. NATHAN makes his way to CALEB, and rests a hand on his shoulder. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man! After a hard day of Turing Tests, you've got to unwind. CALEB raises his voice over the sound of the music. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing with Ava? NATHAN smiles back at NATHAN, smiling, alcohol-glazed. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tore up her picture. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to tear up the fucking dance floor, dude. Check it out. NATHAN sets off towards KYOKO. CALEB watches, amazed, as KYOKO and NATHAN start dancing together. Although NATHAN is drunk, they work through the beats of routine they have obviously done many times before. It's just starting to look weirdly impressive -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - when NATHAN totally loses his balance. On his way down, he lands hard on a glass coffee table. Looking up at him, the glass frosts. 69

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB half-carries the semi-conscious NATHAN. 70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN fumbles in his pocket for his KEYCARD. Drops it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's spinning. CALEB picks the keycard up - - and uses it to swipe the brass plate. The LED turns blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's because you're drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's relativity.   Everything is spinning. CALEB hands the card back to NATHAN, who shoves it back i his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But being drunk does make it worse. 71

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB helps NATHAN into his bedroom. They walk past a semi-circle line of long cabinets, which line the wall opposite the bed. They are like a row of slender wardrobes, each with a mirrored door. Once he's reached the bed, NATHAN tips towards it. It's almost as if he's asleep before he even hits the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he leaves, CALEB glimpses Nathan's study. 73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB'S room.    Lit only by the glow of the television. CALEB is not in the bed. He's on the armchair.    Making himself stay awake. Watching over AVA - - who stands in her room, against the wall, facing away f the CCTV camera, with her arms wrapped around herself. 74

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB and AVA sit, observing each other through their own reflections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, I'm going to test you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Test me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And please remember while you are taking the test that if you lie, I will know. CALEB smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Those pesky micro- expressions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.    So are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Question one. What is your favourite colour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Then what is my favourite colour? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. But it isn't red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.     Hold on a minute... CALEB thinks for a moment. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I get it. I guess seeing as I'm not six, I don't really have a favourite colour. AVA nods. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better answer. Question two. What's your earliest memory? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's actually a memory of kindergarten. There was this kid who -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuts in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.    Wait. CALEB concentrates. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, there is a kind of an earlier memory. But it's ultra vague. It's like... a sound. And, maybe sky. Or blue. No, I think sky. And I think the sound is my mother's voice. AVA nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Question three.      Are you a good person? CALEB laughs. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man. Can we stop the test? You're a walking lie detector, and I've suddenly realised this is a fucking minefield. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We can't stop.      Are you a good person? CALEB takes a breath. AVA keeps watching. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I think so.      I'm a good person. CALEB waits. AVA smiles slightly. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Question four. Who's the most beautiful girl you've ever seen? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm. Beat. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The test is over. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I pass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a relief. AVA reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? CALEB hesitates. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it a relief? AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know... AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just, if there's a test, I guess by definition you want to pass. Beat. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will happen to me if I fail your test? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava - AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will it be bad? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't know. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I might be switched off? Because I don't function as well as I am supposed to? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ava, I don't know the answer to your question. It's not up to me. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it up to anyone? Do you have people who test you, and might switch you off? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.    I don't. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why do I? CALEB shrugs, helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're testing me. But you don't know how I'll pass. And you don't know what will happen if I fail. There's nothing CALEB can say. AVA stares into middle distance for several moments. Then she stands. Then walks to the other side of the room.    Picks someth from her table. Then she returns.    Holding two pieces of paper. She walks up to the glass, and holds them up together. It's the drawing she was doing last light.   The drawing NATHAN tore in half. The drawing is of CALEB. A simple portrait.    Honest, and accomplished. She takes down the drawing. And rests her hand on the console. And - - the lights fail.    The cameras die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power cut.     Back up power activated. For a moment, neither CALEB nor AVA react. Then - AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be with you. Beat. AVA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Question five. Do you want to be with me? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.     I do. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nathan doesn't want us to be together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Beat.    Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ask me one more question. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me if I can out smart him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Can you? CALEB looks directly at her.   Meeting her gaze. Level.   Firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   I can. 76

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN and CALEB sit, each holding a bottle of Peroni, watching the water cloud. Eventually, CALEB speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you make Ava?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an odd question.   Wouldn't you, if you could?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. I don't know. But I'm asking why you did it. NATHAN shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The arrival of strong artificial intelligence has been inevitable for decades. The variable was when, not if. So I don't really see her as a decision. Just an evolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's the next model that's going to be the real breakthrough. Singularity. CALEB reacts - but checks himself. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next model?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Ava. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I didn't know there was going to be a model after Ava. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought she was a one-off? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew there must have been prototypes. So, not the first. But - I thought maybe the last. NATHAN shakes his head. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava doesn't exist in isolation, any more than you or me. She's part of a continuum. Version 9.6. And each time, they get a little better. A few beats of silence, except for the water falling arou them. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So - when you make a new model, what you do with the old one? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Download the mind. Unpack the data. Add the new routines I've been writing. To do that, you end up partially formatting, so the memories go. But the body survives. And Ava's body is a good one. So I'll do the same as I did with Kyoko. CALEB keeps his voice flat, and neutral. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do with Kyoko?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strip out the higher functions. Then reprogram her to help around the house and be fucking awesome in bed. Though I'm thinking I might hang on to the language routines this time. It's kind of annoying not being able to talk to her. Beat. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did realise about Kyoko, right? CALEB is poker-faced. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Beat. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel bad for Ava? CALEB says nothing. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel bad for yourself. One day, the AIs will look back on us the same way we look at fossil skeletons from the plains of Africa. An upright ape, living in dust, with crude language and tools. All set for extinction. NATHAN glances back at CALEB NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?    I really am a God. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am become death, the destroyer of worlds. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go again.   Mister quotable. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No: there you go again. It's not my quote. It's what Oppenheimer said when he made the atomic bomb. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simultaneous) - made the atomic bomb. NATHAN laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it is, dude. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm starting to get why all this fucks with your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. CALEB looks down at the bottle of beer in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. In the meantime, I'd say we're about due a refill. 79

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA sits alone. Watching the door on the other side of the glass, waiting it to open. It remains closed. Beats pass. Then - - unexpectedly, it opens.      Revealing a silhouette fig AVA reacts instinctively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caleb! No.   Wrong silhouette. AVA frowns. KYOKO stands in the door-frame. For a moment, the two look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Who are you? Another beat. 80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the light glows in windows of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP on CALEB'S face. Off-screen, we can hear NATHAN'S voice.    Extremely drun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is what it is. It's Promethean. The clay and fire. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bhagavad Gita. Silence. CUT FROM CALEB'S face, to REVEAL the scene. CALEB sitting on the sofa by the fireplace. NATHAN lying on the floor. Out cold. After a couple of moments, CALEB stands. Then he walks over to NATHAN, and kneels beside him. Then puts his hand into NATHAN'S pocket. And pulls out his keycard. 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to NATHAN'S study opens, and CALEB enters. He walks straight to NATHAN'S desk. And sits down in front of the computer and the bank of monitors. He inserts the KEYCARD into its access slot. The dead monitors immediately come to life. Most of the screens show the CCTV live feeds from around house. The central screen shows the operating system default. A wallpaper of a waterfall. A single folder icon is on the right hand side of the screen. 83

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB inputs commands into NATHAN'S computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hands move fluidly over the keyboard.   His eyes neve leave the screen. ON THE CENTRAL MONITOR SCREEN a series of windows expand stack. We glimpse subject headings.

dialogues.speaker: PROTOCOLS
dialogues.text: In the windows, lines of code appear as CALEB types. 84

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the main room, on the floor, NATHAN stirs. 85

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the MONITORS - - the windows start to collapse. Leaving the default screen.    The waterfall wallpaper. CALEB reaches for NATHAN'S KEYCARD, and is about to remov from the slot - - when something makes him hesitate. His eyes have gone to the folder icon on the right hand s of the screen. It is titled DEUS EX MACHINA. CALEB removes his hand from the keycard. He double-clicks the folder. It expands into a window, which contains a long list of s folders. Each sub-folder is named after a girl. JASMINE, KATYA, JADE, LILY, AMBER, KYOKO, and AVA. 86

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the main room, NATHAN has sat up, and is unsteadily tr to get to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB randomly clicks one of the girl's names.    LILY. LILY'S folder expands into a window, stacked with thumbna images of a girl. CALEB clicks on one of the images at random.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - a CCTV film-clip starting to play. It shows LILY - an android of similar design to AVA - sit with her head bowed. Rocking backwards and forwards, in a gently autistic motion. In the corner of the room, NATHAN leans against the wall, watching.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - CALEB collapsing the LILY menu, and opening KATYA.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: A new film clip. KATYA.   Who is limp.   Lifeless. NATHAN is dragging her towards the induction plate.    He her up, trying to force her to charge. But nothing happens. NATHAN drops KATYA, and she folds to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: CALEB opening JADE.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: The next film clip. NATHAN stands in the glass box inside the observation roo - watching JADE.   A beautiful Asian android girl. They are talking, but we hear no audio.   Some kind of argument, which escalates fast. JADE starts shouting. Then she approaches the glass and starts to hit her hands against it. The glass doesn't break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of JADE'S arms has broken under the force of the blow The hand flails limply where the carbon fibre has splinte at the wrist. Then the other breaks. Throughout, NATHAN simply watches impassively. 88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN has managed to get to his feet. He makes his way up the concrete staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB enters NATHAN'S bedroom. KYOKO is lying on NATHAN'S bed. She's naked.    On her back.   Legs open. Her head turns as CALEB enters. But apart from that, she doesn't react. CALEB walks to the line of long mirrored cabinets opposit the bed. He hesitates. Then pulls the first door open. LILY is inside. Standing upright.     Gazing back at him, frozen, blank eyed. CALEB goes to the next door and opens it. He sees a slender black girl, whose limbs are robotic, bu whose torso and head are synthetic. He opens another door, and another, and another. Then steps back, into the middle of the room, and gazes a the line of android girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned. The camera drifts away from him. Then settles. In the multiple reflections of the open mirror doors, we see KYOKO'S naked and sexually receptive form on the bed behind him. Like an infinity reflection in a hall of mirrors. 91

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB stands above KYOKO'S naked form. He reaches out a hand. She takes it. He gently pulls her to a standing position. Then he moves her arms away from her body... ... and sees, running under her arms in a straight contou over her ribs, there is a faint line. He touches it with his finger. KYOKO steps back. But it's not a defensive action.    It's just to give her space... ... as she reaches under her arm, and adjusts something unseen. And a moment later, the faint line that runs down each side of her torso is opening. As if unzipping. Then KYOKO puts a hand either side of her torso, and pull off the skin covering over her entire chest, in a single section from her collar bone, over the breasts, to her so plexus. Revealing underneath the honeycomb mesh and her robot for 93

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor screens, apparently unnoticed by CALEB, NA is on the live CCTV feed. Making his way along the mezzanine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transfixed, as KYOKO now reaches around the back of her h And finds something on the back of her head, at the nape her neck, inside her hairline. Which unzips the skin around her jaw. Allowing her to remove her face. 95

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN uses the glass wall to support himself. He reaches his door. Then sticks his hand in his pocket for his KEYCARD. But it isn't there. He checks his other pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What the fuck? Suddenly - with both hands in his pockets - he loses bala and crashes to the ground. Lands hard. Lies there for a moment. Groaning.   Blinking.    Catching his breath. Then sees the figure of CALEB standing over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem, Nathan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My card.    I've lost it. A beat. Then CALEB reaches down. Beside where NATHAN lies.    And picks something up from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right here. 96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB enters his bedroom. Shuts the door. AVA is on the TV.    Sat alone in the observation room. CALEB looks at her. She looks at him. He switches the TV off. Lies on the bed.    On his back. Stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHCUT IMAGES.
dialogues.text: Of KYOKO removing her skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB enters the bathroom. He goes to the sink. He looks at his own reflection. Deep into his own eyes. Opens his mouth.    Looks inside. Feels his wrist for his pulse. Feels his skin on the same seam where KYOKO opened hersel Pauses. Then picks up his disposable plastic razor. And breaks it. Forcing it with his hand against the porcelain of the sin Snapping the plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Popping out the tiny razor blade. A beat. Then he picks up the blade between his thumb and forefing Places it against his forearm. And cuts. Blood runs out. CALEB watches it. Sees the way droplets hit the white sink. The way they expand, and merge with existing water droplets. Then he switches the tap on, and puts his arm under the f The water clears away the blood, revealing the cut. CALEB pulls open at the slice with his fingers, spreading Revealing no carbon fibre.   Only muscle. He exhales. And glances up at the mirror, and his own reflection. Then... ... reaches up his forearm, and very deliberately wipes b across the glass. 98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitors in NATHAN'S study, the live feed of CALEB bathroom is partially obscured as CALEB smears the two-wa mirror. Then, through the blood, we see him pull his fist back. And punch the glass. As it shatters, the feed goes dead. Only now REVEAL - - that the person watching the monitor is KYOKO. Her expression is unreadable. Through the glass of the indoor garden, NATHAN lies on th sheets, crashed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunlight on the grass. In the background, we can hear the rhythmic pounding of NATHAN'S punch bag. 100

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN is in a frenzy. Sweat pouring. Obliterating the bag. 101

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA sits alone in the observation room. The door opens. CALEB appears, wearing a long-sleeved shirt. Enters. He sits opposite her, on the other side of the dividing glass. A strange noise escapes from AVA'S mouth. A kind of sob. Curtailed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know where you were. I didn't think you were coming. I waited all yesterday afternoon, and all last night. I didn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I wasn't going to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting? They exchange a look. Then AVA lifts her hand, and rests it against the inducti plate on the console below the window. A final beat. Then the POWER DIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power cut.     Back up power activated. As the emergency lighting lifts, CALEB leans forward slightly. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk. Just listen. You were right about Nathan. Everything you said. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he going to do to me? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to reprogram your AI. Which is the same as killing you. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caleb, you have to help me. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to. We're getting out of here tonight. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   How? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get Nathan blind drunk. Then I take his keycard, and reprogram all the security protocols in this place. When he wakes, he's locked inside, and we've walked out of here. I only need you to do one thing. At ten o'clock tonight, trigger a power failure. Can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long does your battery charge last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty six hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we'll have about a day to get to a cell-phone or kitchen store. Somewhere we can buy an induction plate. After that... CALEB breaks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... we'll work it out. Together. Silence. Then the POWER RETURNS. The lights come back. AVA and CALEB stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caleb. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love y -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - NATHAN'S fist splitting the bag. 104

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clouds spill around the mountain peaks. 105

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KYOKO stands in front of the fireplace. NATHAN leans against the counter in the kitchen area, gaz out of the window. CALEB appears behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what day it is? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your last. The helicopter is coming tomorrow morning. Eight AM. CALEB pauses. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has it been a whole week? NATHAN smiles. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time flies. But what a thing you and I have shared. Something to tell the grandchildren, right? CALEB smiles.    A little tightly. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After they've signed their NDAs. NATHAN laughs. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signed their NDAs! Dude, you crack me up. I'm not getting all maudlin or anything. But straight up. I will miss having you around. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate that. And - let me say: thank you for bringing me here. It's been a trip. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it has. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? CALEB walks over to the kitchen area, and pulls two beers from the fridge. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to drink to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB walks back to NATHAN.     Extends a hand.   Holding Peroni. But NATHAN doesn't take it. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, uh... no, I'm good.     You go ahead. Beat. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want a beer? NATHAN shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Maybe wine or something. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you've noticed - I've been somewhat overdoing it recently. When I woke up this morning, I told myself: time to hit the old detox. CALEB'S hand remains extended.     He smiles again.   Mor tightly. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?      I'm drinking alone? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey - you want to get wasted, knock yourself out. Literally. But I'm on brown rice and mineral water. A beat. CALEB puts down NATHAN'S beer. Then raises his own. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheers. CALEB takes a single sip. NATHAN watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, anyway. Surely this is when you tell me whether Ava passed or if she failed. CALEB pauses. Collecting himself slightly.   Trying to think how to get plan back on track. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Beat. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to keep me in suspense? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her AI is beyond doubt. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?   You mean, she passed? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.   That's fantastic. Beat. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although I've got to admit, I'm surprised. I mean, did we ever get past the chess problem, as you phrased it? As in: how do you tell if a machine is expressing a real emotion, or a just a simulated one? NATHAN pauses. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Ava actually like you?   Or not. CALEB has a cold realisation dawning.   NATHAN is playing him. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though now I stop to think, there is a third option. Not whether she does or doesn't have the capacity to like you. But whether she's pretending to like you. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Beat. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would she do that? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. NATHAN gazes at CALEB evenly. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps - if she saw you as a means of escape. And now CALEB knows: NATHAN knows. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that beer tasting? CALEB puts the beer down. Silence. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buddy. Your head has been so fucked with. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's me whose head is fucked. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure, dude. When I woke up this morning, I saw a tape of you cutting open your arm. Smashing up the mirror. You looked pretty fucked to me. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a bastard. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand why you'd think that. He steps over to CALEB, and rests a hand on his shoulder. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But strange as it may seem, I'm actually the guy who's on your side. NATHAN starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. I'm going to let you off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN and CALEB stand in front of the computer. On it, a clip of film is playing. It shows the scene that CALEB witnessed two nights before NATHAN entering AVA'S room, and an exchange between them. But whereas the first time the sound was muted, this time can hear the audio.

dialogues.speaker: CTTV FILM
dialogues.text: NATHAN stands above AVA.   Drunk. AVA is sat at the table, with her drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's watching us right now, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cameras are on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But he doesn't get an audio feed. I didn't want you two communicating outside of my line of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN reaches over and picks up her picture of CALEB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So all he can see is two people having a chat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN studies the picture for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it strange to have made something that hates you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Then abruptly, NATHAN rips the picture. He lets the two pieces fall to the floor. As AVA reaches for them, NATHAN turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And exits. 107

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN hits pause. Glances at CALEB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right about the hot magician's assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Misdirection. I rip her picture, which she can then present as an illustration of my cruelty to her, and her love for you. And at the same time, in full view of you both...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he talks, NATHAN rewinds the film clip slightly -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it allows me to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... then FREEZES the film again. This time, ON THE SCREEN: AVA is reaching for her torn picture. And NATHAN is reaching out with his hand. And his hand is holding something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a new camera in the room. Battery powered, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN unfreezes the image. And we quite clearly see NATHAN place the object on AVA'S bookcase. NOTE THAT on the two previous occasions we have seen this clip of film, we will have seen him do this action. But n register it, instead reading the action as him drunkenly using the shelf to steady himself. CALEB stares at the monitor for a few moments. Then turns. He walks towards a chair.    And sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he does so, NATHAN has started to play another clip. CALEB can hear the audio. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recording) We're getting out of here tonight. AVA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recording) What? How? CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recording) I get Nathan blind drunk. Then I take his keycard, and reprogram the all security protocols in this place. When he wakes, he's locked inside, and we've walked out of here. I only need you to do one thing. Trigger a power failure at ten o'clock tonight. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. The recording stops. CALEB feels short of breath. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel stupid. But you shouldn't. Proving an AI is exactly as problematic as you said it was. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was the real test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. Beat. NATHAN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava was a mouse in a mousetrap. And I gave her one way out. To escape, she would have to use imagination, sexuality, self- awareness, empathy, manipulation - and she did. If that isn't AI, what the fuck is? CALEB looks upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Directly above, he sees a spot-light in the ceiling. It dazzles him. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So my only function was to be someone she could use to escape. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Yes. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't select me because I was good at coding. NATHAN hesitates. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get me wrong. You're okay. Even pretty good, but - CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You selected me by my search engine inputs. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They showed a good kid. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With no family. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a moral compass. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no girlfriend. CALEB stares into the brightness above him. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you design her face based on my pornography profile? NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, dude. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you? Beat. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. If a search engine's good for anything - right? Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I say one thing? CALEB doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The test worked. It was a success. Ava demonstrated true AI. And you were fundamental to that. If you could just separate - NATHAN cuts off.   Because AT THAT MOMENT - - the lights and the monitors suddenly die. 108

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the circular window, the emergency lighting lifts The window glows red. 109

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA'S head turns to the door of her room. Where, discretely, the LED by the keycard plate glows blu 110

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The power cut. Must be ten o'clock. NATHAN glances at CALEB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess Ava's going to be wondering where you are. CALEB says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was that escape going to go down, anyway? You didn't completely explain. You said you were going to get me drunk, take my card, then reprogram the security protocols. But, reprogram them to - what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To change the lockdown procedure. So that in the event of a power cut, instead of sealing, the doors all opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.     Might have even worked. CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll find out. NATHAN frowns. NATHAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? CALEB looks away from the dimmed ceiling light, to NATHAN CALEB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured you were probably watching us during the power cuts. Beat. CALEB (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I already did all those things. When I got you drunk yesterday. NATHAN freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What? At that moment, the POWER COMES BACK ON. The lights rise. The computer monitors come back to life. Revealing something. On the CCTV feed of AVA'S room, the door is open. And on the feed of the GLASS CORRIDOR - - AVA is walking down it. NATHAN freezes as he sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both NATHAN and CALEB simultaneously rise. Almost as an afterthought, NATHAN lands a deceptive, fast punch into CALEB'S solar plexus. CALEB folds, the air forced out of him, gasping for breat NATHAN helps him down to the floor. A couple of yards away is one of his curl dumbbells. He walks over. Picks the dumbbell up. Spins off the weights.    Leaving him with a thick metal Then exits. 111

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN enters the GLASS CORRIDOR. He sees, directly ahead of him, at the far end of the corridor, AVA and KYOKO. They stand together. KYOKO'S mouth is by AVA'S ear, as if telling her a secret Her lips are open.   They don't move. CLOSE UP to KYOKO'S lips, we hear a hiss of static, with pulses of noise buried inside. Then the two robot women become aware of NATHAN'S presenc They turn to face him. A beat. Then AVA starts walking towards NATHAN. NATHAN'S fingers flex around the metal bar in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava. AVA doesn't slow or react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava - now listen to me. I want you to go back to your room. AVA has reached halfway down the corridor. She stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I do, are you ever going to let me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. CLOSE UP.   NATHAN'S micro expressions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP.   On AVA. Then AVA breaks into a run. Sprinting in NATHAN'S direction. 112

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet in the garden. Soft wind rush. Moon and stars reflected in the windows of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA impacts NATHAN, and they fly backwards. Then land hard. NATHAN gets to his feet first. AVA tries to rise too. And he kicks her extremely hard in the torso. She is knocked back down. NATHAN glances around. There is no talking. Just NATHAN'S laboured breathing. Then he walks back to AVA, looking down at her. He swings the metal bar. AVA raises her left arm defensively - - and shockingly, the bar smashes through it. Crushing th delicate mesh, shattering the carbon fibre bone structure Breaking the arm half way down the forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - CALEB, dragging himself up, stunned by the sight on the CCTV feed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - NATHAN.   Preparing to deliver a lethal blow. But as he does so, we see something. KYOKO. Approaching behind NATHAN. She's holding something in her hand. She walks directly up to NATHAN. And does something behind his back. As she does so, KYOKO emits the first sound we have heard make. A little gasp, or sigh. NATHAN jolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down. Something is under his shirt, just above his solar plexus little ridge. He tugs the material of his shirt open - - and reveals a tiny triangle of metal.    Protruding fro skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns. The handle of a KITCHEN KNIFE is jutting out of the middl his back, just left of his spine. It has been jammed so d that the tip of the blade has poked out of his chest. Blood soaks into his shirt material with amazing speed, blossoming from the point of the wound. He sees KYOKO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.   No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lashes out with the metal bar. It catches KYOKO in the jaw. Her entire lower jaw snaps off. It reveals metal armature, and carbon fibre, and spurting pneumatic fluid. And something in her neck, glowing and sparking. Then she folds down to the ground, as her power abruptly out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking - unreal - As NATHAN stares down at KYOKO - - reveal that AVA has got to her feet behind him. She pulls the knife out of his back. Feeling this happen, NATHAN turns - - and AVA pushes the knife into his chest. NATHAN stares at AVA. Then takes a slight step away from her. And sits down heavily on the white carpet. Crimson drips onto bleached fibre. Beats pass on this strange image: KYOKO sprawled on the floor with her broken face. NATHAN sitting upright, his upper torso now drenched in blood. AVA standing.   Watching NATHAN. After a few moments, NATHAN slumps sideways. And stops breathing. 113

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB sees this same view, on the CCTV camera feed, on NATHAN'S monitors. Then - - AVA starts walking. As she walks, she discards the broken section of her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the cameras, CALEB watches her progress through the ho Down the glass corridor. Through the threshold to NATHAN' private quarters. Then - - CALEB raises his head from the screens. To see AVA standing at the open door to NATHAN'S study. AVA and CALEB look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you stay here? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Okay. AVA leaves, closing the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO -
dialogues.text: - the monitors. The CCTV feed of AVA walking down the connecting corridor NATHAN'S BEDROOM. 114

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA stands in NATHAN'S BEDROOM, in front of the previous androids. She is unclothed. She gazes at the androids. Then she removes the arm from JADE, and replaces her own shattered limb. She takes a moment to see how the new limb looks in the mirrors. Then she starts removing sections of JADE'S skin. And putting it on herself. The skin sucks itself to the honeycomb mesh, as if the me and the underside of the skin are magnetised, attracted t each other. As a large section of skin is removed from her torso, JAD who has been motionless until now - turns her head slight to look at AVA. They exchange a glance.    Locking eyes for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transfixed, CALEB watches AVA'S metamorphosis. First through the glassed-off garden that separates Natha study from his bedroom. Then, when he can't get a clear v through the foliage, on the monitors. 116

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First light breaks over the mountains. 117

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glow of honeycomb mesh vanishes as AVA applies the la section of skin. Nothing of her robot forms remains. She closes the door on JADE, and now sees herself in the mirrored door on JADE'S cabinet. AVA sees a naked human girl.      And is hypnotised by th of herself. 118

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB watches as AVA - now clothed - walks back down the connecting corridor to the study... ... then passes straight by his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava? CALEB gets up. Goes to the closed door.       Tries to open it. There is a red LED light by the keycard plate.     Locked He swipes his card, with his photo ID. The red light remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava! He runs back to the monitors. On them, AVA has reached the GLASS CORRIDOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA stands in the glass corridor. She looks at KYOKO'S body for a moment. Her expression is unreadable. Then she walks up to NATHAN'S body. There, she stops. Crouches down. And takes NATHAN'S bloodstained keycard out of his pocket Then stands. She walks straight to the elevator. Uses the KEYCARD. And steps through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA walks up the glass staircase from the main room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA steps outside for the first time.   Into the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB sticks his card into the slot by NATHAN'S computer. Instantly, THE EMERGENCY LIGHTING COMES UP and all the screens die. Replaced by a single word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the garden, we can see CALEB through the glass of th circular window, shouting Ava's name. On our side of the glass, there is silence. AVA walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB looks up at the thick glass of the circular window, several metres above him. Far out of reach. He starts to shout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ava!   AVA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATHAN'S body. KYOKO'S body. 121

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA stops. Absorbing the sunrise, the view of the sky, and the mountains. Then the moment is broken by a sudden pulse of rotor blad - as the shuttle HELICOPTER flies directly overhead. 122

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter sweeps over the glacier, into the valley. 123

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter touches down. The rotors stop. And the PILOT climbs out. Takes off his helmet. Looks at the girl standing a few metres away. Nothing betrays that AVA is anything other than a pretty in her early twenties. AVA turns as he approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - AVA'S precise POINT OF VIEW. Looking at the PILOT. The image echoes the POV views from the computer/cell-pho cameras in the opening moments of the film. Facial recognition vectors flutter around the PILOT'S fac And when he opens his mouth to speak, we don't hear words We hear pulses of monotone noise.   Low pitch.   Speech a pattern recognition. This is how AVA sees us.   And hears us. It feels completely alien. 126

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AVA and the PILOT finish talking. We are too distant to hear their conversation. But whatever is said, a few beats later, the PILOT goes t helicopter and opens the passenger door, to allow AVA to enter. Then he goes back to the PILOT'S door. Gets in. And the rotor blades start to turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - the view from the circular window as the helicopter tak off, banks away from the house, and starts climbing.

dialogues.text: putchar(a); putchar (b);putchar (c); putchar('!'*n');

dialogues.text: a `goo'; b `dby'; c `e, wo -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - a busy traffic intersection.    Somewhere in North Amer In the crowd, we glimpse AVA.    Just for a moment. CUT TO BLACK.
